org.conqat.engine.resource.util

Class UniformPathUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.engine.resource.util.UniformPathUtils

  • public class UniformPathUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for dealing with uniform paths.

        public static final char SEPARATOR_CHAR
        The character used as path separator in uniform paths.

        public static final java.lang.String SEPARATOR
        String representation of SEPARATOR_CHAR.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UniformPathUtils

        public UniformPathUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • extractProject

        public static java.lang.String extractProject(java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Extracts the project part of a uniform path, which is everything up to the first SEPARATOR_CHAR.

      • stripProject

        public static java.lang.String stripProject(java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Returns the path without the project, i.e. removes everything up to the first SEPARATOR_CHAR.

      • getElementName

        public static java.lang.String getElementName(java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Returns the element name for a uniform path, which is the everything starting from the last SEPARATOR_CHAR.

      • getParentPath

        public static java.lang.String getParentPath(java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Returns the parent path for a path which is everything up to the last non-escaped SEPARATOR_CHAR. If no separator is found, the empty string is returned.

      • removeFirstSegments

        public static java.lang.String removeFirstSegments(java.lang.String uniformPath,
                                                   int count)
        Removes the first count segments from the given path.

      • removeLastSegments

        public static java.lang.String removeLastSegments(java.lang.String uniformPath,
                                                  int count)
        Removes the last count segments from the given path.

      • splitPath

        public static java.lang.String[] splitPath(java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Returns segments forming the given path.

      • getExtension

        public static java.lang.String getExtension(java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Returns the extension of the uniform path.
        Returns:
        File extension, i.e. "java" for "FileSystemUtils.java", or null, if the path has no extension (i.e. if a path contains no '.'), returns the empty string if the '.' is the path's last character.

      • normalizeAllSeparators

        public static java.lang.String normalizeAllSeparators(java.lang.String path)
        Replaces forward and backward slashes, not only system-specific separators, with a forward slash. We do this on purpose, since paths that e.g. are read from files do not necessarily contain the separators contained in File.separator.

      • cleanPath

        public static java.lang.String cleanPath(java.lang.String path)
        Creates a clean path by resolving duplicate slashes, single and double dots. This is the equivalent to path canonization on uniform paths.

      • resolveRelativePath

        public static java.lang.String resolveRelativePath(java.lang.String basePath,
                                                   java.lang.String relative)
        For a uniform path denoting a file and a relative path, constructs the uniform path for the relatively addressed element.

      • concatenate

        public static java.lang.String concatenate(java.lang.String... parts)
        Returns the concatenated path of all given parts. Empty or null strings are ignored.

      • prependProject

        public static java.lang.String prependProject(java.lang.String projectName,
                                              java.lang.String path)
        Creates a uniform path by prepending the project to the given path. If the project is null, it is ignored.

      • createSystemIndependentPath

        public static java.lang.String createSystemIndependentPath(java.lang.String path)
        Remove drive letters or unix root slash from path. Also normalizes the path.
